detailsOfAchievement: It was on July 10, 1980- Sum 29 years ago Gobardanga Shilpayan came into existence in North 24 Parganas, West Bengal. A long span of nearabout three decades of relentless theatrical cultivation Gobardanga Shilpayan had a long walk of success and failure juxtapposed with a series of innovative excitement. Apart from producing theatre Gobardanga Shilpayan has been organizing different cultural function viz, arranging Seminars, Felicitation Ceremonies, Exhibition of Photos of different productions of different theatre organization, Theatre Workshop, Gobardanga Natya Mela and also speeches on theatre. Goberdanga Shilpayan has been on the talk of theatre lovers of almost all the provinces of india by some of its stage winning productions like - MALADAK, SWAPNER FERIWALA, TARAPRASANNER KIRTI, COLONEL-KE KEU CHITHI LEKHA NA, TAMAS, SHYLOCK UPPAKHAN, TOTA KAHINI, ANTARJALI YATRA, SATYA SHYLOCK, ANKUR, KHOWAB and BRINDABANER CHE directed by Ashis Chattopadhyay - the helmsman of the group. We have decided to make this dream in reality our drama group Gobardanga Shilpayan, Inagurate a theatre school (Gobardanga Shilpayan Natya Vidyalaya) on 10th day of July 2006. Gobardanga Shilpayan and Swapnasandhani joint venture for producing a theatre production PRACHYA, under the direction of Koushik Sen in the year 2002. Gobardanga Shilpayan has travelled all over India with its dramas performing in some of the most prestigious festivals as well as small rural interiors and industrial suburbs. Persently excitement in the group is on the wings following the attainment of HUTCH sponsorship in there "Odeon 2005" Theatre Festival for the groups latest production ANTERJALI YATRA with the script and direction by Ashis Chottopadhyay. Gobardanga Shilpayan never thinks that all these they have beenable to do of their own Support, assistance and above all inspiration from all the corners and particularly by the optimistic and Co-operative attitude of Government and prominent Pritate Organization have alwayas been plying a major role behind it. However Goberdanga Shilpayan will never deviate from their resolve to go on with an all out strive to ensure healthy progressive and affirmative milieu of positive culture in the country through their cumulative involvement in theatre and theatrical works. So far acknoledgements is concerned Gobardanga Shilpayan had won these awards : * Shamal Sen Samma 2000 (Best Production) for the production "MALADAK". * Sayak Samman 2003 (Best Production and Best Director - Ashis Chattopadhyay) for the production "COLONEL-KE KEU CHITHI LEKHA NA". * Shamal Sen Samma 2004 (Best Actress - Dipa Brahma) for the production "MALADAK". * West Bengal Natya Akademy Award 2003 (Best Director - Ashis Chattopadhyay) for the production "COLONEL-KE KEU CHITHI LEKHA NA". * Perona Samman 2004 (Best Director - Ashis Chattopadhyay) for the production "TAMAS". * Sayak Samman 2005 (Best Playwriter - Ashis Chattopadhyay) for the production "TAMAS". * Bijan Bhattacharjee Smriti Samman 2007 (Best Production) for the production "SATYA SHYLOCK". * Niva Arts Samman 2009 (Production and Best Actor - Shouvik Sarkar for the production "KHOWAB".

detailsOfAchievement: THEATRE RESEARCH & DEVELOPMENT: Performance(120 shows in a year), Different type of Seminars & Workshops, Children workshop  School Children, Slum Children & Child Labor, Deaf & Dumb, Blind Children, Tribal, SC & ST Children, In search of Children Theatre, Capacity Building Workshops, National Theatre Festival, Natya Utsav, Inter School Theatre Festival, Folk Festival, Computer Training, In-House Theatre Training, Celebration in World Environment Day, Sachha Bharat Avijan, Children Day, World Women Day, World Theatre Day, Group Foundation Day, Kabi Pronam, Awareness of Consumer Right. Debu Memorial Award: as GURU PRONAM to MR. RUDRAPRASAD SENGUPTA; PADMASHREE NIRANJAN GOSWAMI & MR. SURESH DUTTA, MR. BIBHAS CHAKRABORTY; MR. CHANDAN SEN; IN 1016 MR. MANOJ MITRA. ACHIEVMENTS: Last 35 years, GOBARDANGA NAKSHA produced 45 productions. Apart from all those productions NAKSHA also produced Workshop based productions in which children and students took participations in 40 plays and 2 Puppet plays. In the journey of NAKSHA during last 35 years also produced 7 Mime performances. Some of notable productions are KHARIR GONDI(Telecasted on DD Bangla, Doordarshan Kendra, Kolkata), ATHA SIKSHA BICHITRA(Telecasted on ATN Bangla), DAKGHAR, TIN PAISER PALA, YADI AR EKBAR, EKHONO, JION PALA, SHANI, ATMAJA, LEBEDEFF, MAHANAGAR, GHORAR DIMER GAPPO, SWAPNA SWADESH, RAJAR ASHUKH, RANGE BANGE RABI, BILASIBALA, CHELETA, SUVA, ICHHAPURAN, GHARE BAIRE, BINODINI: A WOMAN A HUMAN, TIRANDAJ DAMON, THOLI BURIR GAPPO, GOBARGANESH etc. AWARD: In 2003 ATMAJA awarded by PASCHIMBANGA NATYA AKADEMI, Dept. of Information & Cultural Affairs, GOVT. OF WEST BENGAL as BEST PRODUCTION OF THE YEAR. In 2003 UTTAM MUKHOPADHYAY SMARAK SAMMAN by MEGHOOT NATYA SANASTHA, KOLKATA for TOTAL THEATRE ACTIVITIES. In 2005 SHYAMAL SEN SMRITI SAMMAN by SWAPNASANDHANI, KOLKATA for TOTAL THEATRE ACTIVITIES. In 2009 BIJON BHATTACHARYA SMRITI PUROSKAR for production KHARIR GONDI by BENGAL SHRACHI GROUP, KOLKATA. In 2012 GOUTAM ROYCHOWDHURY MEMORIAL AWARD by BAHARAMPUR RITWIK for TOTAL THEATRE ACTIVITIES. In 2011 BADAL SARKAR MEMORIAL AWARD for production BILASIBALA by NATYAPANJIKA, KOLKATA. Our Founder President & Director of NAKSHA MR. ASHIS DAS is a SENIOR FELLOWSHIP AWARDEE by the MINISTRY OF CULTURE, GOVT. OF INDIA in the field of THEATRE for the year 2008-2009. BEST DIRECTOR AWARD BY MUNAS, KOLKATA. SOVON PUROSKAR by MADHYAMGRAM AVIJATRI. TATHAGATA MEMORIAL AWARD by BARASAT BIKSHAN. Our Secretary and senior Actress of NAKSHA MS. DIPANWITA BANIK DAS is a SENIOR FELLOWSHIP AWARDEE by the MINISTRY OF CULTURE, GOVT. OF INDIA in the field of THEATRE for the year 2013-2014. Our student MS. LINA DAS got CCRT scholarship last year. MS. BHUMISUTA DAS also got young artist scholarship from MINISTRY OF CULTURE, GOVT OF INDIA IN 2016. She also got Debabrata Chakraborty Memorial Award in 2014 by Radhanagar Darpan, Kolkata. In 2015 she got Biswadev Dutta Memorial MEDHA PUROSKAR; IN 2013 She got best actress (Binodini: a woman a human) award from Natyapanjika, Kolkata. She also goes to South Korea for 28 days residential theatre workshop. IN 2015 WE ARE BUILD UP A EXPERIMENTAL SPACE (30X40X22) CALLED GOBARDANGA SANSKRITI KENDRA. It was inaugurated by Honourable Minister MR. BRATYA BASU on last 3rd October,2015.

detailsOfAchievement: GOBARDANGA RUPANTAR has been a pioneer of social activities since 1973 whose objective is to produce and enact dramas with the help of young and energitic participants.The themes highlight social elils and public enlightment caused thereby.The various other activities include arranging seminers, Festivals,Theatre Workshop, Exhibitions and Training Programmes. Gobardanga Rupantar have staged Dramas, at Kolkata in various wellknown Theatre Halls like Rabindrasadan,Purbasree(E.Z.C.C.),Academy of Fine Arts,Sisir Mancha,Minarva Theatre,Bijan Theatre, Kasi Biswanath Mancha,and also at Suri Rabindra Sadan,Allahabad Bengali Recreation Club,Lucknow Bengali Club Hall, Gobardanga Town Hall, Ashoknagar Sahid Sadan, Barasat Rabindra Bhavan & Sudhi Prodhan Mancha, Basirhat Town Hall, Halisahar Binodini Mancha etc. Gobardanga Rupantar have Produced 22 Full length Drama like Sajano Bagan,Surya Shikar, Chalachitta Chancari,Sashti, Dakgarh,Achalayatan, Badnam etc.,16 Short length Drama like Haradhaner Dashti Chhele, Michil, Pakhi, Lathi,Rupantarer Goppo, Rupkota Noi, Swapanpurer Pthik, Simanta Santras, Chhuti etc. & 8 Childern Drama like Lanka Dahan Pala, Ankamalar Deshe, Jay Baba Hanunath, Cham cham kumar,Ha-ja-ba-ra-la,Tasher Desh etc. Gobardanga Rupantar also organised Seminers(financially Assistance by The Ministry of culture, Govt.of India), Theatre workshop & Rupantar Natya Utsav (every year since 2001-02) and Published a Book Bengali Theatre of last Five Decades of the Previous Centurywith financial assistance by the Ministry of culture, Govt. of india. Gobardanga Rupantar performed Dramas in response of invitation from Natya Akademi, (Ministry of Culture,Govt. of West Bengal) at Natya Mela-Kolkata,Rabindra Sadan (Suri),Sudhi Prodhan Mancha (Barasat)etc. & invitation from E.Z.C.C.( Ministry of culture, Govt. of india.) At Purbasree (Salt-Lake).Gobardanga Rupantar is awarded by different organisation like Sudeb Saha Smriti Samman, Sanglap Award, Shipayan Samman, Gobardanga Theatre Fedaration Samman etc.

detailsOfAchievement: GOBINDAPUR SEPHALI SAMAJ SEBA SAMITY is a registered society. The Society is formed on 23rd Sept. 2003,having its own registered office at Vill.-Gobindapur,P.O-Keleti,P.S-Aushgram,Dist.-Burdwan,West Bengal-713128, has started its operation during the year 2003. The mission of the society is to promote,advance and encourage and / or aid in helping,promoting, advancing and encouraging primary,secondary and higher education including technical, and vocational skill and empowering the target group with knowledge and skill across various sector also physical training,training of handicrafts,fine art and others useful arts, crafts among the public including the establishment and maintenance of shilpa- shikshalayas,kala-kendras and other welfare centers for them. The strategic objectives of the social includes, establishing various educational, technical,vocational institutions, skill training centers etc. and operating such institutions-centers with desired outcome for the benefit of the target group without any profit motive. Income Tax Department has been pleased to issue 80G & 12 A Certificate to the Society keeping into notice the charitable activities of the society since its inception. Institutes and training centers running under the umbrella of Gobindapur sephali samaj seba samity:- Gobindapur Sephali Memorial Polytechnic,Approved by AICTE and Affiliated to WBSCT & VE &SD(Since Year 2010) offering Diploma Courses in Civil,Mechanical,Electrical,Electronics & Telecommunication and Computer Sc. & Technology in two shifts with gross intake capacity 604 in every year including lateral entry students.The Institute has separate boys and girls hostel. Sepahli Memorial Private ITI(Since Year 2015) accredited by QCI and Affliated by DGET offering CTS Courses Leading to NTC from NCVT in Fitter, electrician and Welder trades with a gross seating capacity 146 Students. Running Vocational training Centers (since year 2010) carried out activities for imparting skills related to employability and entrepreneurship training offering short term skill training courses in different towns and village. Further the Society alone & inform of consortium with two other organisations ha s become as a private training providers (PTP) and awarded by Government of West Bengal to Operate Seven Government ITIs in PPP Mode. The Institutes are Binpur-II Govt. ITI,Nayagram Govt. ITI.Sagar Govt. ITI,Patharpratima Govt. ITI,Bhatar Govt. ITI,Purbasthali-I Govt. ITI,Purbasthali-II Govt. ITI. Tripartite Concessions agreement between Govt. Of West Bengal,Gobindapur Sephali samaj Seba Samity and NSDC has been made for this purpose. Thus Today Gobindapur Sephlai samaj Seba Samity has developed sturdy organisational competencies in the field of technical and vocational education and skill training with a highly motivated and dedicated team of skill personnel and ready to accept any challenge in the domain to realize its mission.

detailsOfAchievement: GJUBBWWC is working to ensure that poor tribal people of the region will get equal opportunity in life so that they can live their life with happiness and self-respect. We try to ensure that every single child of the region gets proper food and quality education and we are doing this from past 19 years! Our Vision: Our vision is that every child in our action area evolves as a healthy, educated, self-reliant adult with the ability and drive to break free from poverty while improving their own communities. Our Mission: Our mission is to bring real and lasting change to the tribal people of the region. In partnership with contributors, we reduce their daily struggles, invest in their potential, and provide them with the opportunity to grow up healthy, educated and prepared to succeed and contribute to society. Our goal: Our goal is to truly affect the lives of impoverished children, women, their families and communities through our programs to relieve the burdens these people face and improve their quality of life.
